newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Metrobank sheds 7.5 pct on foreign selloff.
newsitem.headline: Metrobank sheds 7.5 pct on foreign selloff.

text.p: Metropolitan Bank & Trust Co (Metrobank) dipped by 45 pesos, or 7.5 percent, to 555 pesos in mid-trade on Thursday on foreign selling as brokers said the Philippines is once again being compared with Thailand.

"It's a reaction to what is happening in Thailand, rumours of a possible devaluation of the baht. People are concerned about possible attacks on the peso and on the exposure of banks," said Dennis Rayala, research head at Abacus Securities Corp.
On Wednesday there was speculation that the baht will be devalued.
"It's the parallel (drawn) to Thailand," said Nathan Lozada, assistant vice-president at Philippine Asia Equity.
Earlier on Thursday, the Philippine Central Bank raised overnight interest rates by 0.75 percentage points to 12 percent.

The Bank said it was prepared to boost interest rates again to protect the peso. It said the rise in overnight rates was a preemptive move in case there is any spillover from the problems in Thailand.
Metrobank was the most heavily-traded issue at mid-session with turnover of 140.36 million pesos.
The bank led several blue chips in dragging the Manila stock market main index down two percent in mid-session.
